title: üìÜhistory
desc: Even though Bitcoin is only 12 years old, it has an illustrious history!

msgs.text: Even though Bitcoin is only 12 years old, it has an illustrious history!

Some significant events in Bitcoin's history: 

Bitcoin Prehistory (1973 - 2009)
A graphic outlining the major events that eventually led to Bitcoin can be seen here: https://discord.com/channels/874318808423219280/874319602811801670/874328138002337893

The Liberty Dollar (1998)
Despite being forbidden by the Constitution, Bernard von Nothaus minted a new form of currency, later cited by Satoshi in 2008 for inspiring his creation of Bitcoin. More on the Liberty Dollar: 
https://youtu.be/argq_cxalZ8

Bitcoin Whitepaper released by Satoshi (October 31, 2008)
Read the Bitcoin whitepaper here: 
https://bitcoin.org/bitcoin.pdf

Bitcoin network went online (January 3, 2009)
Satoshi Nakamoto mined the genesis block of bitcoin (block number 0), which had a reward of 50 bitcoins. Embedded in the coinbase of this block was the text: The Times Jan/03/2009 Chancellor on brink of second bailout for banks.

"Running Bitcoin" tweet by developer, cryptographer and second person on the Bitcoin network, Hal Finney (January 10, 2009)
https://twitter.com/halfin/status/1110302988

First peer-to-peer (P2P) Bitcoin transaction (January 12, 2009)
Satoshi sent 10 bitcoin to Hal Finney. Finney wrote in a Bitcointalk forum: ‚ÄúI mined block 70-something, and I was the recipient of the first bitcoin transaction when Satoshi sent ten coins to me as a test. I carried on an email conversation with Satoshi over the next few days, mostly me reporting bugs and him fixing them..." https://mempool.space/tx/f4184fc596403b9d638783cf57adfe4c75c605f6356fbc91338530e9831e9e16
Here is the first transaction on the blockchain: https://www.blockchain.com/btc/tx/f4184fc596403b9d638783cf57adfe4c75c605f6356fbc91338530e9831e9e16

1309.03 Bitcoin sold for $1 on the New Liberty Standard exchange (October 5, 2009)

1 bitcoin = $0.0009 (October 12, 2009)
Martti Malmi, a Finnish developer that helped Satoshi work on Bitcoin, sold 5050 bitcoin for $5.02.

Bitcoin Market exchange launches (February 2010)
Bitcointalk user named dwdollar created a portal called Bitcoin Market in which bitcoins could be bought and sold from person to person including payment systems such as Paypal. Mt. Gox also launched in this year and became the first large scale exchange (and recipient of the first large bitcoin hack). More on Mt. Gox: 
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mt._Gox

Bitcoin Pizza Day (May 22, 2010)
Florida man Laszlo Hanyecz paid for two Papa John's pizzas with 10,000 Bitcoin (now valued at half a billion dollars). This was the first known monetary transaction of Bitcoin. 
For more on this including the exact blog post the transaction originated from as well as the actual transaction ID on the Blockchain, 
see: https://bitcoinpizzaindex.net/

Developer Gavin Anderson creates a Bitcoin Faucet (June 11, 2010)
Gavin purchased 20,000 Bitcoin for $50. He then created a Bitcoin faucet, or website to give away the Bitcoins. All people had to do was complete a Captcha and then they would be sent around five BTC for free. For more: https://medium.com/crypto-blog/blast-from-the-past-get-5-free-bitcoins-from-gavin-andersen-53a842722923

Satoshi implements a 1 MB blocksize limit into the code (July 15, 2010)
This soft fork came into force on September 7, 2010 at block height 79,400.

Satoshi's final public correspondence (December 12, 2010)
A post on the bitcointalk.org forum: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=2228.msg29479#msg29479

Silk Road launches with bitcoin as primary payment method (February 2011)
This was an online black market and the first modern darknet market, best known as a platform for selling illegal drugs. It was eventually shut down by the FBI in 2013.

More on Silk Road: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Silk_Road_(marketplace)

Post about Bitcoin hitting $1 for the first time (February 12, 2011)
https://m.slashdot.org/story/147526

Bitcoin's price jumped from $1 in to a peak of $32 in June, a 3,100% gain (April-June 2011)

The Winklevoss twins announce large Bitcoin purchase (2012)
With settlement money from their Facebook lawsuit, the Winklevoss twins purchased $11 million of Bitcoin, some for as little as $10 a coin.

Pay to Script Hash soft fork activated (April 1, 2012)
Activated on Block #173805. Using P2SH, you can send bitcoins to an address that is secured in various unusual ways without knowing anything about the details of how the security is set up.

Formation of the Bitcoin Foundation (Late 2012)
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bitcoin_Foundation

Market cap reaches $1 billion (March 2013)
The price of Bitcoin moved from about $40 to $90 by the end of 03/2013.

Price of 1 bitcoin = 1 oz of gold (December 2013)
Price of both was a little over $1000

Origin of "HODL" meme (December 18, 2013)
This meme came from a drunken rant posted to the Bitcointalk forums by user GameKyuubi: 
https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=375643.0

Some of the first companies to accept Bitcoin payments were Expedia, Overstock, TigerDirect, Newegg, Dell, Rakuten, Microsoft and Steam. (2015-2016)

Block Size Wars (2015 - 2017)
There is a debate about Bitcoin's block size. Some say the block size limit is too small to be scalable (which is now a myth, see <#874338300721250324>). This eventually led to a hard fork which created the alt coin Bitcoin Cash. This showed the resiliency of Bitcoin itself, as people who want to change it (no matter how rich they are) have no power over the majority consensus.

Bitcoin reaches an all time high (December 18, 2017)
Price: $20,089

SegWit Upgrade (2017)
SegWit is the process by which the block size limit on a blockchain is increased by removing signature data from bitcoin transactions.

Market cap reaches $100 billion (October 2017)
The price of bitcoin moved from about $4000 to $6000 by the end of 10/2013.

Market cap reaches $1 trillion (February 2021)
The price of bitcoin reached an all time high $64,805 on 04/14/21.

Country adopts bitcoin as legal tender (June 8, 2021) 
El Salvador's Legislative Assembly voted to establish Bitcoin as unrestricted legal tender, making El Salvador the first sovereign nation to formally adopt Bitcoin. Bitcoin officially became legal tender on 9/7/2021 when on the same day, El Salvador bought 400 BTC making it also the first country to add BTC to its balance sheet.

Taproot Upgrade (November 14, 2021)
A Bitcoin update mainly to improve privacy.

More on the history of Bitcoin: 
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/History_of_bitcoin
More: 
https://en.bitcoinwiki.org/wiki/Bitcoin_history

Cool thread revealing more about Satoshi's interactions with Bitcoin's first adopters
https://twitter.com/francispouliot_/status/1106026078135611392

https://99bitcoins.com/bitcoin/historical-price/

Comprehensive Academic research library of early Bitcoin publications, organized by year:
https://cdecker.github.io/btcresearch/

Bitcoin was not forged in a vacuum. These works serve to contextualize Bitcoin into the broader story of cryptography and freedom. All of them predate Bitcoin:
https://nakamotoinstitute.org/literature/

Posted by Satoshi Nakamoto on February 11, 2009:

http://p2pfoundation.ning.com/m/discussion?id=2003008%3ATopic%3A9402
‚ú® Satoshi explaining the 21 million #Bitcoin supply limit exactly 12 years ago
Hal Finney 2011
Satoshi Nakamoto published this thirteen years ago
2011 when "satoshis" got their name
2011 post from Hal Finney about bitcoin reaching $1

Bitcoin.org 
This was the first Bitcoin website, registered by the network's first two developers, Satoshi Nakamoto and Martti Malmi.
2009. Satoshi explain that with Bitcoin's decentralization, it is different than anything previously attempted
2010 Satoshi replying to a post about mining when the block reward was 50 bitcoin

2010 Satoshi replying to an energy concern, saying that Bitcoin's energy expenditure is justified. Also includes one of the rarest things to ever happen on the internet‚Äîsomeone admitting a reply actually changed their mind.

March 19, 2013 9 years ago today. "Bitcoin and me" post by Hal Finney 
https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=155054.msg1643833#msg1643833

Adam Back post 2013
Adam Back post 2013
Adam Back post 2013
Adam Back post 2013

Calendar of Bitcoin Events and Celebrations January 3 *Proof of Keys Day* The birthday of Bitcoin (2009), PoK Day exists to cement the unique attributes of Bitcoin, to take your coins off of exchanges and make sure everyone holds their Bitcoin themselves. April 28 *Satoshi Disappear Day* https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=6730.0 May 22 *Bitcoin Pizza Day* See this post for details on the celebration: https://discord.com/channels/874318808423219280/877196139881963594/877196513569288202 August 1 *Bitcoin Independence Day* The official end of the Blocksize Wars. On August 1, 2017, Bitcoin users demonstrated their independence from miner control by successfully deploying a software upgrade through a user-activated soft fork (UASF) that circumvented uncooperative miners, making it clear that users (ie nodes), not miners or companies, control the rules of the Bitcoin network. August 21 *Bitcoin Infinity Day* Inspired by Knut Svanholm's "Everything Divided by 21 Million." Stack 21 times your normal daily average stack More Bitcoin holidays by NVK: https://bitcoin.holiday/

THE MT. GOX FLEX üîè
On June 23, 2011, Mt. Gox CEO Mark Karpeles sent a MASSIVE transaction of 442,000 BTC.

The transaction was a way for Karpeles to offer reassurance, and signal proof of custody over the MT GOX exchange funds.
https://mempool.space/tx/3a1b9e330d32fef1ee42f8e86420d2be978bbe0dc5862f17da9027cf9e11f8c4

In July 2014, U.S. Marshals Service auctioned 29,655 BTC seized from the Silk Road. Tim Draper won the auction for just ~$18M at the time.

Despite being a non-violent, first time offender, Silk Road creator, Ross Ulbricht is serving a double life sentence.
https://mempool.space/tx/9e95c3c3c96f57527cdc649550bf8e92892f7651f718d846033798aee333b0c3

On November 16, 2011, a bitcoin whale sent the largest amount of bitcoin ever to move in a single transaction in the amount of 500,000 BTC.

At the time worth $1.13M, but today is worth OVER $10 BILLION dollars.
https://mempool.space/tx/29a3efd3ef04f9153d47a990bd7b048a4b2d213daaa5fb8ed670fb85f13bdbcf
